intro: Rossioglossum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are characterized by their broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Rossioglossum species typically produce showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
